introSection.favoriteTechEnd: includes Python, Go, SQLite, Tailwind CSS, and Visual Basic for Applications.

about.subtitle: Want to know more?
about.paragraph: I taught myself how to code out of curiosity about how things work and how to improve them. Small experiments quickly grew into tools that made tasks more efficient and more effective. Here are a few examples that show how I work:

1.name: Driven and thoughtful
1.description: When I take on a project, I stick with it. I like breaking problems into steps and working through them until they make sense. I’d rather build something solid than rush into quick fixes that don’t last.

2.name: Clear and collaborative
2.description: With a background in social work, I know how much communication matters. Whether working with colleagues or building for others, I keep ideas clear and feedback valued. The best tools are created together with the people who use them.

3.name: A programmer who solves problems
3.description: For me, coding is about making life easier. I’ve built scripts that save hours, apps that anyone can use, and small utilities that smooth daily work. Every project teaches me something new and expands my skillset.
